    "text": " Alright. So welcome to the deep dive, everybody. Today, we're gonna be taking a look at some really interesting stuff you sent our way. We're talking Indonesian volcanoes. "

  {

    "end": "00:00:17.000",
    "speaker": "2",

  },
  {
    "start": "00:00:17.000",
    "end": "00:00:24.000",
    "speaker": "1",
    "text": " Yeah. And get this. All of the sources you sent are blog posts, but these aren't just, like, you know, your average blog post. They're packed with visuals. "
  },
  {

  },
  {
    "start": "00:00:31.000",
    "end": "00:00:45.000",
    "speaker": "2",
    "text": " Sounds good. It is really fascinating how these topics, you know, they might seem different at first glance. But when you really look at it, they all connect back to using data. Using data to make sense of the world around us. Right? "
  },
  {
    "start": "00:00:45.000",
    "end": "00:00:46.000",
    "speaker": "1",
    "text": " Which one's got clear. "
  },
  {
    "start": "00:00:46.000",
    "end": "00:00:52.000",
    "speaker": "2",
    "text": " Whether that's natural phenomena or human behavior. Even cultural trends, we can look at it all through data. "
  },
  {
    "start": "00:00:52.000",
    "end": "00:00:59.000",
    "speaker": "1",
    "text": " Yeah. Absolutely. Okay. So let's just jump right in. The first blog post that you sent is about modeling Indonesian volcanoes. "

  {

  {

    "text": " I love that. That's a great way to introduce 3D modeling, right? "
  },
  {
    "start": "00:01:12.000",
    "end": "00:01:13.000",
    "speaker": "1",
    "text": " Yeah. "
  },
  {
    "start": "00:01:13.000",
    "end": "00:01:19.000",
    "speaker": "2",
    "text": " And the blog post actually does a really good job of walking you through how to create a 3D model of a volcano, "

  {
    "start": "00:01:20.000",
    "end": "00:01:21.000",
    "speaker": "2",
    "text": " using elevation data. "
  },
  {
    "start": "00:01:21.000",
    "end": "00:01:21.000",
    "speaker": "1",
    "text": " Okay. "
  },
  {
    "start": "00:01:21.000",
    "end": "00:01:29.000",
    "speaker": "2",
    "text": " And it they even include, like, a simplified example so you can really grasp the process. Even if you've never, you know, worked with 3D modeling before. "
  },
  {
    "start": "00:01:29.000",
    "end": "00:01:34.000",
    "speaker": "1",
    "text": " That's awesome. So the goal here is to compare four, pretty popular Indonesian volcanoes. "

  {

    "end": "00:01:35.000",
    "speaker": "2",
    "text": " Okay. "

  {
    "start": "00:01:35.000",
    "end": "00:01:42.000",
    "speaker": "1",
    "text": " Agung, Bromo, Merapi, and Semeru. And they're looking at not just height, but volume as well. "

  {
    "start": "00:01:42.000",
    "end": "00:01:42.000",
    "speaker": "2",
    "text": " Interesting. "

  {
    "start": "00:01:42.000",
    "end": "00:01:49.000",
    "speaker": "1",
    "text": " And they're using R programming to create some really impressive visualizations both in 2D and 3D. What did those visualizations show? "
  },
  {
    "start": "00:01:49.000",

    "speaker": "2",
    "text": " Well, you can see right away the shape of each volcano, the features. "
  },
  {
    "start": "00:01:53.000",
    "end": "00:01:53.000",
    "speaker": "1",
    "text": " Okay. "
  },
  {
    "start": "00:01:53.000",
    "end": "00:01:57.000",
    "speaker": "2",
    "text": " Really distinct. Much more engaging than just looking at numbers on a spreadsheet, I have to say. "

  {
    "start": "00:01:57.000",
    "end": "00:01:57.000",
    "speaker": "1",
    "text": " Yeah. Yeah. "
  },
  {
    "start": "00:01:57.000",
    "end": "00:02:02.000",
    "speaker": "2",
    "text": " And they found that Semeru is the tallest, but Bromo had the largest volume. "
  },
  {
    "start": "00:02:03.000",
    "end": "00:02:07.000",
    "speaker": "1",
    "text": " Wow. Okay. So that's interesting. So it's not necessarily, like, the tallest one is the biggest one. "
  },
  {
    "start": "00:02:07.000",
    "end": "00:02:17.000",
    "speaker": "1",
    "text": " That's really neat, and it really shows you just how important it is to visualize data. Imagine if we could see other geographical features in 3D, like canyons, mountain ranges even. "
  },
  {
    "start": "00:02:17.000",
    "end": "00:02:22.000",
    "speaker": "2",
    "text": " Yeah. What if we could take this approach and represent abstract datasets this way? "

  {
    "start": "00:02:22.000",
    "end": "00:02:23.000",
    "speaker": "1",
    "text": " That would be wild. "
  },
  {
    "start": "00:02:23.000",
    "end": "00:02:33.000",
    "speaker": "2",
    "text": " Yeah. The post makes you think about the possibilities of 3D modeling and how it can help us understand and engage with information in ways we never thought of before. "
  },
  {
    "start": "00:02:33.000",
    "end": "00:02:36.000",
    "speaker": "1",
    "text": " Totally. Okay. Are you ready to switch gears a little bit? "
  },
  {
    "start": "00:02:36.000",
    "end": "00:02:36.000",
    "speaker": "2",
    "text": " Sure. "
  },
  {
    "start": "00:02:36.000",
    "end": "00:02:42.000",
    "speaker": "1",
    "text": " The next blog post that you sent analyzes how well Indonesia's national soccer team's been doing. "
  },
  {
    "start": "00:02:42.000",
    "end": "00:02:42.000",
    "speaker": "2",
    "text": " Okay. "
  },
  {
    "start": "00:02:42.000",
    "end": "00:02:50.000",
    "speaker": "1",
    "text": " And they connect it to the country's Independence Day celebrations, which adds this whole other layer of national pride to the whole thing. "
  },
  {
    "start": "00:02:50.000",
    "end": "00:03:03.000",
    "speaker": "2",
    "text": " Yeah. I love that. They used FIFA World ranking data to track Indonesia's performance over time, and they compare it to other Southeast Asian countries. What I thought was really cool was that they had this animated chart. "
  },
  {
    "start": "00:03:03.000",
    "end": "00:03:06.000",
    "speaker": "2",
    "text": " That showed how those rankings changed over time dynamically. "
  },
  {
    "start": "00:03:06.000",
    "end": "00:03:07.000",
    "speaker": "1",
    "text": " Oh, wow. "
  },
  {
    "start": "00:03:07.000",
    "end": "00:03:10.000",
    "speaker": "2",
    "text": " You can actually see how Indonesia climbed into the top five recently. "
  },
  {
    "start": "00:03:10.000",
    "end": "00:03:15.000",
    "speaker": "1",
    "text": " That's incredible. It makes you wonder what they were doing differently that led to that climb. You know? "
  },
  {
    "start": "00:03:15.000",
    "end": "00:03:20.000",
    "speaker": "2",
    "text": " Yeah. The blog post points out that their lowest ranking was when there was a FIFA sanction. "
  },
  {
    "start": "00:03:20.000",
    "end": "00:03:21.000",
    "speaker": "1",
    "text": " Oh, okay. "
  },
  {
    "start": "00:03:21.000",
    "end": "00:03:27.000",
    "speaker": "2",
    "text": " It makes you realize how outside events can affect a team. Even in sports, there's always a bigger context to consider. "
  },
  {
    "start": "00:03:27.000",
    "end": "00:03:41.000",
    "speaker": "1",
    "text": " Yeah. There's always something else going on behind the scenes. To add even another layer to this, the blog post mentions that in 1998, Indonesia had its highest ever FIFA ranking. I wonder what contributed to that success. "
  },
  {
    "start": "00:03:41.000",
    "end": "00:03:50.000",
    "speaker": "2",
    "text": " It is fascinating, isn't it? What were the conditions back then? Were there certain strategies they were using, certain players? Data can help us uncover these stories. "
  },
  {
    "start": "00:03:50.000",
    "end": "00:03:52.000",
    "speaker": "1",
    "text": " Yeah. Maybe learn from the past. "
  },
  {
    "start": "00:03:52.000",
    "end": "00:03:53.000",
    "speaker": "2",
    "text": " Exactly. "
  },
  {
    "start": "00:03:53.000",
    "end": "00:04:01.000",
    "speaker": "1",
    "text": " Okay. Let's move on to your next source. This one dives into biodiversity modeling in Indonesia's Raja Ampat Islands. "
  },
  {
    "start": "00:04:01.000",
    "end": "00:04:02.000",
    "speaker": "2",
    "text": " These are the full part of the world. "
  },
  {
    "start": "00:04:02.000",
    "end": "00:04:06.000",
    "speaker": "1",
    "text": " Oh, yeah. A region known for its, really stunning natural beauty. "
  },
  {
    "start": "00:04:06.000",
    "end": "00:04:16.000",
    "speaker": "2",
    "text": " Now this post is part of a larger project on sustainability education, all about using mathematical modeling to help us understand and protect these ecosystems. "
  },
  {
    "start": "00:04:16.000",
    "end": "00:04:24.000",
    "speaker": "1",
    "text": " And the author talks about how they found the data they needed for this whole thing. Right? They started with the scientific paper that didn't actually include the raw data. "
  },
  {
    "start": "00:04:24.000",
    "end": "00:04:25.000",
    "speaker": "2",
    "text": " Oh, interesting. "
  },
  {
    "start": "00:04:25.000",
    "end": "00:04:32.000",
    "speaker": "1",
    "text": " So they actually emailed one of the researchers and ended up getting access to a ton of information on plant diversity all on these small islands. "
  },
  {
    "start": "00:04:33.000",
    "end": "00:04:44.000",
    "speaker": "2",
    "text": " That's awesome. That's a great example of how, you know, a little initiative can go a long way. And once they had that data, they used it to figure out the connection between the size of the island and how many plant species are on it. "
  },
  {
    "start": "00:04:44.000",
    "end": "00:04:50.000",
    "speaker": "1",
    "text": " Okay. So they used, like, linear models, power models, logarithmic models, even a Weibull model. "
  },
  {
    "start": "00:04:50.000",
    "end": "00:04:51.000",
    "speaker": "2",
    "text": " Wow. That's a lot. "
  },
  {
    "start": "00:04:51.000",
    "end": "00:04:56.000",
    "speaker": "1",
    "text": " Yeah. They even used RMSE to figure out which model was the best fit for the data. "
  },
  {
    "start": "00:04:56.000",
    "end": "00:04:59.000",
    "speaker": "2",
    "text": " Now RMSE stands for root mean squared error. "
  },
  {
    "start": "00:04:59.000",
    "end": "00:04:59.000",
    "speaker": "1",
    "text": " Okay. "
  },
  {
    "start": "00:04:59.000",
    "end": "00:05:13.000",
    "speaker": "2",
    "text": " And it basically tells you how well a model's predictions match up with the real data. The lower the RMSE, the more accurate the model is. I thought it was cool that they used a free online graphing calculator called Desmos, "
  },
  {
    "start": "00:05:13.000",
    "end": "00:05:14.000",
    "speaker": "1",
    "text": " Oh, neat. "
  },
  {
    "start": "00:05:14.000",
    "end": "00:05:17.000",
    "speaker": "2",
    "text": " to refine the initial parameters for the Weibull model. "
  },
  {
    "start": "00:05:17.000",
    "end": "00:05:23.000",
    "speaker": "1",
    "text": " Oh, that's a great tip. Shows you that you don't need, like, fancy software to do some really interesting data analysis. "
  },
  {
    "start": "00:05:24.000",
    "end": "00:05:33.000",
    "speaker": "2",
    "text": " Absolutely. And their key finding, island size is positively correlated to the number of plant species, bigger islands, more plant diversity. "
  },
  {
    "start": "00:05:33.000",
    "end": "00:05:33.000",
    "speaker": "1",
    "text": " Okay. "
  },
  {
    "start": "00:05:33.000",
    "end": "00:05:35.000",
    "speaker": "2",
    "text": " But it's not simple relationship. "
  },
  {
    "start": "00:05:35.000",
    "end": "00:05:35.000",
    "speaker": "1",
    "text": " Right. Right. "
  },
  {
    "start": "00:05:35.000",
    "end": "00:05:38.000",
    "speaker": "2",
    "text": " It's not just linear. That's where the Weibull model comes in. "
  },
  {
    "start": "00:05:38.000",
    "end": "00:05:48.000",
    "speaker": "1",
    "text": " Okay. That makes sense. It makes you think about what this means for conservation efforts. You know? How can we use this knowledge to protect biodiversity in Raja Ampat and beyond? "
  },
  {
    "start": "00:05:48.000",
    "end": "00:05:55.000",
    "speaker": "2",
    "text": " Great point. It's a great example of how we can use data to make real world decisions and have a positive impact on the environment. "
  },
  {
    "start": "00:05:55.000",
    "end": "00:06:06.000",
    "speaker": "1",
    "text": " Absolutely. Alright. So let's wrap up part one of this deep dive with your final source. This one's all about how the music industry makes money, and it starts with the author reminiscing about cassette tapes. Remember those? "
  },
  {
    "start": "00:06:06.000",
    "end": "00:06:08.000",
    "speaker": "2",
    "text": " Oh, of course. Takes me back. "
  },
  {
    "start": "00:06:08.000",
    "end": "00:06:25.000",
    "speaker": "1",
    "text": " Yeah. Me too. But what really caught my eye was that the blog post focuses on this interactive chart from the Recording Industry Association of America, the RIAA. Which tracks how much money the US music industry makes over time and breaks it down by format. "
  },
  {
    "start": "00:06:25.000",
    "end": "00:06:26.000",
    "speaker": "2",
    "text": " Interesting. "
  },
  {
    "start": "00:06:26.000",
    "end": "00:06:31.000",
    "speaker": "1",
    "text": " Yeah. It's amazing how much information they managed to pack into just this one chart. "
  },
  {
    "start": "00:06:31.000",
    "end": "00:06:38.000",
    "speaker": "2",
    "text": " What I thought was really impressive was how they managed to communicate these trends so well, even though it's, you know, kind of an unconventional approach. "
  },
  {
    "start": "00:06:38.000",
    "end": "00:06:39.000",
    "speaker": "1",
    "text": " Yeah. "
  },
  {
    "start": "00:06:39.000",
    "end": "00:06:44.000",
    "speaker": "2",
    "text": " Using a bar chart with time on the x axis shows the power of good design. "
  },
  {
    "start": "00:06:44.000",
